sentences.sContent: She’s one of the most experienced teachers in the district.
sentences.sCn: 她是该地区最有经验的教师之一。

sentences.sContent: The most important thing is to stay calm.
A recent study showed that gardening is easily the most popular activity among the over 50s.
sentences.sCn: 最近的一项研究表明园艺绝对是50岁以上人群中最受欢迎的活动。

sentences.sContent: We shall find out which system works most effectively.
sentences.sCn: 我们要找出哪个系统效率最高。

sentences.sContent: It is the kind of tea most often served in Chinese restaurants.
sentences.sCn: 这是中国餐馆里最常用的茶。

sentences.sContent: The president himself won the most votes.
sentences.sCn: 总统本人赢得了最多的选票。

synos.tran: 大部分的，多数的；最多的

phrases.pCn: 最重要的；首要的；最关键的
大部分，大多数的；绝大多数
绝大部分时间，在很多时候
最经常；很多时候；通常来说
adv. 在极大程度上，多半
最有价值球员；最优秀选手
最尊敬的大主教大人（大主教的尊称）

trans.tranOther: having the greatest amount of a particular quality

trans.tranCn: 大部分的，多数的；最多的
trans.tranOther: You use the most to mean a larger amount than anyone or anything else, or the largest amount possible
nearly all of the people or things in a group, or nearly all of something
